example.text: The levels of immunoreactive IB begin to return to basal levels following 3-4 h exposures to poly IC.
example.arg: return to basal levels following 3-4 h exposures to poly IC
example.fdg:
1 The the det:>2 @DN> %>N DET 2 levels level subj:>6 @SUBJ %NH N NOM PL 3 of of mod:>2 @5 @A> %>N A ABS 5 IB ib pcomp:>3 @

example.text: When they were transferred to a glucose-containing medium in order to deplete these proteins, growth of gaal, gpi8 and gpi16 deletants began to decline at 12, 6 and 6 h , respectively, after transfer and ceased at 24, 12 and 12 h.
example.arg: growth of gaal, gpi8 and gpi16 deletants
example.fdg:
1 When when tmp:>4 @ADVL %EH ADV WH 2 they they subj:>3 @SUBJ %NH PRON PERS NOM PL3 3 were be v-ch:>4 @+FAUXV %AUX V PAST PL 4 transferred transfer @-FMAINV %VP EN 5 to to ha:>4 @ADVL %EH PREP 6 a a det:>8 @DN> %>N DET SG 7 glucose-containing glucose-containing attr:>8 @A> %>N A ABS 8 medium medium pcomp:>5 @

example.text: Growth of the gpi17 deletant began to decline at 6 h after transfer to a glucose-containing medium, but growth continued slowly for 33 h.
example.arg: to decline at 6 h after transfer to a glucose-containing medium
example.fdg:
1 Growth growth subj:>6 @SUBJ %NH N NOM SG 2 of of mod:>1 @5 @DN> %>N DET 4 gpi17 gpi17 attr:>5 @A> %>N N NOM SG 5 deletant deletant pcomp:>2 @

0 @+FMAINV %VA V PAST 7 to to pm:>8 @INFMARK> %AUX INFMARK> 8 decline decline obj:>6 @-FMAINV %VA V INF 9 at at ha:>8 @ADVL %EH PREP 10 6 6 qn:>11 @QN> %>N NUM CARD 11 h h pcomp:>9 @
